intro: Stillingia acutifolia, commonly known as the sharp-leaved stillingia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a pointed tip, giving it its common name. Stillingia acutifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
